summary: This document is a chain of emails from July to September 2021 between law enforcement personnel (FBI, NYPD, and US Attorney's Office) regarding outreach to a potential witness who claims to have been Ghislaine Maxwell's assistant and to possess information relevant to the prosecution. The emails coordinate scheduling an interview and note that an FBI 302 report is being prepared.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the prosecution; a potential witness claims to have been her assistant.

events.title: Interview with Potential Witness
events.description: An FBI agent spoke with a potential witness who claims to have been Ghislaine Maxwell's assistant.

events.title: FBI 302 Report Awaiting Serialization
events.description: An FBI 302 report based on an interview with a potential witness is written and awaiting formal serialization.

keyFacts: A potential witness contacted law enforcement in July 2021, identifying herself as Ghislaine Maxwell's former assistant and offering to help the prosecution.
FBI and NYPD personnel coordinated to have an agent speak with this witness, with contact made by September 20, 2021.
By September 22, 2021, an FBI 302 report documenting the witness interview was written and awaiting serialization.
The email chain shows active coordination between the FBI New York Field Office, NYPD, and the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding witness outreach.
The witness reportedly lived with the individual who forwarded the initial tip while working for Maxwell.
